corpname.value: Poly Archives & Special Collections at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology

unittitle.value: Guide to the Judith Bregman Collection, 1966-1993

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Judith Bregman was a professor of Physics at Polytechnic Institute of New York from 1957 until her death in 1978. During her time at Poly, she developed an interest in the preparation of instructional films, and is perhaps most well-known for her film 'Symmetry', which was created in 1966 in cooperation with Alan Holden, Richard Davisson, and Philip Stapp. This collection is comprised of 16 mm films Bregman helped to create and mass-produced educational films she used for classroom instruction. Some personal information about Bregman and her work is also included in the collection.

p.value: Identification of item, date; RG-013: Judith Bregman Collection; box number, folder number; Poly Archives & Special Collections at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology.

The film reels and containers were transferred to Bern Dibner Library of Technology & Science from the Physics Department in 1995 and stored in a glass and metal cabinet in the archives. Preliminary lists and finding aids were found in the cabinet when assessed in 2013.
Source: The above information is from Bregman's obituary in Physics Today, which can be found at Phillips, M. (1978). Judith Bregman. Physics Today. 31(12), 71. doi: 10.1063/1.2994888

The collection also contains five film reel shipping containers in which the films were originally stored. The films are also accompanied by correspondence, grant proposals and contracts, reviews and articles of the films, film stills from Symmetry, documents from the Bergman Film Library account, and biographical materials about Bregman.

corpname.value: Polytechnic Institute of New York University -- Department of Physics.

dsc.value:
Series I: Biographical materials Biographical Materials 1 1 1968-1978 Series II: Correspondence 1966-1991 Scope and Contents note

Hellmut Juretschke (then head of the physics department) received and responded to some correspondence after Judith Bregman's death, therefore some correspondence addressed to Bregman appears in Juretschke's folders of correspondence. Some death notices and Juretschke's speech at Bregman's memorial are also included in folder 2.

-- 1984-1986 1 32 1984-1986 Bregman Film Account -- 1980-1983 1 33 1980-1983 Bregman Film Account -- 1977-1979 1 34 1977-1979 Schwartz Memorial Library Fund 1 35 1986-1991 Series VII: Original film library lists Film lists found in Bregman film cabinet 1 36 undated Series VIII: Audio/Visual Materials undated Scope and Contents note

Contains 35 16mm films. The first subseries contains films produced by Bregman through grant-funded projects while at Polytechnic, including "Symmetry." Additional subseries are comprised of films used by Bregman for class instruction, or which were otherwise part of her film library. All films are organized according to their original groupings as determined by Bregman.

Severe red shift; Vinegar Syndrom Volta and Electricity 4 34 undated red shift, vinegary Weather in Motion #20 (From ATS-I Synchronous Satellite) 4 35 undated "50" 4 36 severe red shift, slightly warped; vinegar syndrome Slide Presentation with Audio Cassette 4 1 1984 Scope and Contents note

Consists of one "Moments of Discovery" book including Teacher's Guides and Scripts for units on the discovery of fission, and pulsars. Also included are two audio cassette tapes and 20 black and white slides, some exhibiting damage.

 Series IX: Original shipping containers 1974-1986 Scope and Contents note

Five film reel shipping containers constructed of carboard with reinforced metal corners, label slots, and cotton buckles.
